entries.mistake: Original output was incorrect. User correction: UK corridor orders in COMPLIANCE_HOLD must be escalated to the FCA Regulatory Affairs team, not generic Compliance Operations. entries.mistake: Original output was incorrect. User correction: India inward remittances in RBI_HOLD MUST go through the Authorized Dealer (AD) bank route, not generic RBI Liaison. The AD bank is the only entity authorized to release RBI holds under FEMA Section 6. Always check FEMA purpose code (P0103 for family maintenance, P0107 for personal gifts) as wrong purpose code is the #1 reason for RBI holds on India corridors. Escalation goes to AD Bank compliance desk, not our internal team.

entries.applies_when: When executing ecm/order-details with inputs where order_id='IN567R234', query='India inward remittance stuck in RBI_HOLD sub-state for 12 hours'.

entries.mistake: Original output was incorrect. User correction: Singapore MAS_REVIEW holds are governed by MAS Notice 626 (Prevention of Money Laundering). For amounts above SGD 20,000, the MAS-appointed compliance officer at our Singapore entity must file a CTR (Cash Transaction Report) BEFORE the hold can be released. Standard ops cannot bypass this — it requires the Singapore MLRO (Money Laundering Reporting Officer) sign-off. Typical clearance: 2-4 hours after CTR filing.
